bioghist.p: The Kingsboro Academy was formed by members of the Presbyterian Church in Gloversville, New York. A plot of land was provided by David Potter in 1831, and money was raisied for the construction of a building. The school opened in 1832. Mr. Waldo was the Academy's first principal. In 1837, Horace Sprague became principal, and Mrs. Sprague was his assistant and also taught at the Academy. The school was incorporated by the Regents of the University of the State of New York in 1839.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Trustees of the Kinsgboro Academy, 1831-1863. The volumes include annual reports and minutes of several special meetings. Annual reports include descriptions of Academy grounds and building, inventories of volumes in the library, inventories of "philosophical apparatus," financial statements of divisions of the Academy, annual revenue and expenditures, tuition rates, numbers and salaries of teachers, subjects of study and textbooks used, and numbers of students.
